subject: Re: [junit] Running Junit tests with several JREs within another test

messageBody:
On 10/13/05, Elliotte Harold <elharo@...> wrote:
> Kent Beck wrote:
>
> > I checked with JUnit 4 and noticed that it doesn't call System.exit(), so
> > that's something we need to fix.
>
> Now how are you going to write a test case for that? :-) (only half joking)

Well, I see Kent already suggested actually forking a new JVM. My only
concerns for that are: it's a fair amount of work (means the test is
slow), and there are multiple reasons why a JVM may exit.

As an alternative: set a security manager that will disallow an exit.
Then check for the SecurityException being thrown.
